channel.title: [rscd] Alternative exp formula for combat
channel.description:
First lets open the file Formulae.java inside the source folder (src/org/rscdaemon/config), then lets find this:
[code] double exp = ((mob.getCombatLevel() * 2) + 10) * 1.5D;[/code]
now lets replace it with this:
[code] double exp = (Math.pow(mob.getCombatLevel(), 2) / 2) + 20D;[/code]
Ok now save and compile. Yep that's all! :)
So what is this good for?
[ul][li]This will cut down some grinding at higher combat levels.[/li] [li]Will work on any RSCD based server basically.[/li][/ul]
The problem with the old way of gaining exp from NPCs is that would get more exp per hour training at low level things (chickens, cows or rats) since you don't need food or armor. And that makes training pretty boring and tiring, so many ppl just go with bots or spend they time doing afk training.
Now low level NPCs will not be the best options for training when you could be getting much better exp at the higher lever monster you can face, thus making it more fun and improving the economy of the server since you would need the best armor/weapon and food/potions available.
Here is comparison of the old and new ways of getting exp from NPCs.
[code] Old exp level exp chicken 3 24 giant rat 13 54 red spider 36 123 lesser demon 79 252 red dragon 145 450
New exp level exp chicken 3 24.5 giant rat 13 104.5 red spider 36 668 lesser demon 79 3140.5 red dragon 145 10532.5[/code]

item.title: [rscd] Alternative exp formula for combat
item.dc:creator: @Protosstribe object
item.description:
@Protosstribe wrote:

I am not sure how the formulae in RSCE is, but I know the formulae in RSCA is wrong. So, if RSCE also uses the same formulae as RSCA, then it would be wrong too. The formulae I found out a few years ago when checking RSC was the following (which so far seems to be correct for NPCs):

total exp = Combat level * 2 total exp += 20 hits exp = exp / 4 attack exp = is controlled ? hits exp : is on accuracy mode ? hits exp * 3 : 0 defence exp = is controlled ? hits exp : is on defensive mode ? hits exp * 3 : 0 strength exp = is controlled ? hits exp : is on aggressive mode ? hits exp * 3 : 0

For players, just change the “total exp += 20” to “total exp += 10” and it aswell should be correct (as far as I can remember).

Read full topic

item.title: [rscd] Alternative exp formula for combat
item.dc:creator: @latifundio latifundio
item.description:
@latifundio wrote:

Thanks to Marwolf for reporting that even at 1x rate in constants.java, he was getting 56k from a knight.

Seems like exp is affected if exprate is also set in player.java (Dark Quest only?)
Should look like this:

if(i < 7) { exprate *= 1; } else { if(World.getWorld().isDoubleXpWeekend()) { exprate *= 2; } }

Read full topic

item.title: [rscd] Alternative exp formula for combat
item.dc:creator: @nacional nacional
item.description:
@nacional wrote:

but hasn’t higher level npcs always given more xp, the problem with high level monsters is that
it takes a lot longer to kill. If you mean higher xp to compensate for the time it takes to kill a high lvl monster than I get it now thanks :D.

Read full topic

item.title: [rscd] Alternative exp formula for combat
item.dc:creator: @X_Smokethis X Smokethis
item.description:
@X_Smokethis wrote:

nacional:

idgi

Low level npcs like chickens will give low xp, Higher npcs will be higher xp
Atm, Its chickens/low level npcs give too much xp for there level.

So I guess its trying to balance things out

Read full topic

item.title: [rscd] Alternative exp formula for combat
item.dc:creator: @latifundio latifundio
item.description:
@latifundio wrote:

First lets open the file Formulae.java inside the source folder (src/org/rscdaemon/config), then lets find this:

double exp = ((mob.getCombatLevel() * 2) + 10) * 1.5D;

now lets replace it with this:

double exp = (Math.pow(mob.getCombatLevel(), 2) / 2) + 20D;

Ok now save and compile. Yep that’s all!

So what is this good for?

[ul][li]This will cut down some grinding at higher combat levels.[/li]
[li]Will work on any RSCD based server basically.[/li][/ul]

The problem with the old way of gaining exp from NPCs is that would get more exp per hour training at low level things (chickens, cows or rats) since you don’t need food or armor. And that makes training pretty boring and tiring, so many ppl just go with bots or spend they time doing afk training.

Now low level NPCs will not be the best options for training when you could be getting much better exp at the higher lever monster you can face, thus making it more fun and improving the economy of the server since you would need the best armor/weapon and food/potions available.

Here is comparison of the old and new ways of getting exp from NPCs.

[code]
Old exp
level exp
chicken 3 24
giant rat 13 54
red spider 36 123
lesser demon 79 252
red dragon 145 450

New exp
level exp
chicken 3 24.5
giant rat 13 104.5
red spider 36 668
lesser demon 79 3140.5
red dragon 145 10532.5[/code]
